page.title: 16Looking at Birds
page.content: Walking around the study area, visitors see many different types of bird, ranging from the more common chaffinch to the migrating swallow. Walking from Durlston on the coastal footpath, brings you to a special birdwatch sight where you can observe fulmars, shags, kittiwakes, herring gulls, razorbills, guillemots, and many other birds. Some have nesting colonies along these cliffs, others just visit them each day. Further west puffins have their nests. Many groups of migrating birds can be identified here, some arriving from distant lands, others leaving our shores, some just passing through!
